parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the AWS Elemental MediaConnect resource for which to list the tags.
parameters.name: resourceArn

get.description: List all tags on an AWS Elemental MediaConnect resource

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the AWS Elemental MediaConnect resource to which to add tags.
parameters.name: resourceArn

tags.description: A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

post.description: Associates the specified tags to a resource with the specified resourceArn. If existing tags on a resource are not specified in the request parameters, they are not changed. When a resource is deleted, the tags associated with that resource are deleted as well.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the AWS Elemental MediaConnect resource from which to delete tags.
parameters.name: resourceArn

parameters.description: The keys of the tags to be removed.
parameters.name: tagKeys

delete.description: Deletes specified tags from a resource.

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per API request. For example, you submit a ListEntitlements request with MaxResults set at 5. Although 20 items match your request, the service returns no more than the first 5 items. (The service also returns a NextToken value that you can use to fetch the next batch of results.) The service might return fewer results than the MaxResults value. If MaxResults is not included in the request, the service defaults to pagination with a maximum of 20 results per page.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListEntitlements request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListEntitlements request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

get.description: Displays a list of all entitlements that have been granted to this account. This request returns 20 results per page.

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per API request. For example, you submit a ListFlows request with MaxResults set at 5. Although 20 items match your request, the service returns no more than the first 5 items. (The service also returns a NextToken value that you can use to fetch the next batch of results.) The service might return fewer results than the MaxResults value. If MaxResults is not included in the request, the service defaults to pagination with a maximum of 10 results per page.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListFlows request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListFlows request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

get.description: Displays a list of flows that are associated with this account. This request returns a paginated result.

availabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone that you want to create the flow in. These options are limited to the Availability Zones within the current AWS Region.

entitlements.description: The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow.

outputs.description: The outputs that you want to add to this flow.

source.description: The settings for the source of the flow.

allOf.description: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.
A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.
The name of the source.
The protocol that is used by the source.
The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
The name of the VPC interface to use for this source.

The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
Search window time to look for dash-7 packets

vpcInterfaces.description: The VPC interfaces you want on the flow.

post.description: Creates a new flow. The request must include one source. The request optionally can include outputs (up to 50) and entitlements (up to 50).

parameters.description: The ARN of the flow that you want to start.
parameters.name: flowArn

parameters.description: The ARN of the flow that you want to stop.
parameters.name: flowArn

parameters.description: The ARN of the flow that you want to delete.
parameters.name: flowArn

delete.description: Deletes a flow. Before you can delete a flow, you must stop the flow.

parameters.description: The ARN of the flow that you want to describe.
parameters.name: flowArn

get.description: Displays the details of a flow. The response includes the flow ARN, name, and Availability Zone, as well as details about the source, outputs, and entitlements.

parameters.description: The flow that you want to update.
parameters.name: flowArn

allOf.description: Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets

parameters.description: The flow that you want to grant entitlements on.
parameters.name: flowArn

entitlements.description: The list of entitlements that you want to grant.

post.description: Grants entitlements to an existing flow.

parameters.description: The ARN of the entitlement that you want to revoke.
parameters.name: entitlementArn

parameters.description: The flow that you want to revoke an entitlement from.
parameters.name: flowArn

delete.description: Revokes an entitlement from a flow. Once an entitlement is revoked, the content becomes unavailable to the subscriber and the associated output is removed.

parameters.description: The ARN of the entitlement that you want to update.
parameters.name: entitlementArn

parameters.description: The flow that is associated with the entitlement that you want to update.
parameters.name: flowArn

description.description: A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.

encryption.description: Information about the encryption of the flow.

allOf.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).
A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).
The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.
The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

entitlementStatus.description: An indication of whether you want to enable the entitlement to allow access, or disable it to stop streaming content to the subscriber’s flow temporarily. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect leaves the value unchanged.

subscribers.description: The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.

put.description: You can change an entitlement's description, subscribers, and encryption. If you change the subscribers, the service will remove the outputs that are are used by the subscribers that are removed.

parameters.description: The flow that you want to add outputs to.
parameters.name: flowArn

outputs.description: A list of outputs that you want to add.

post.description: Adds outputs to an existing flow. You can create up to 50 outputs per flow.

parameters.description: The flow that you want to remove an output from.
parameters.name: flowArn

parameters.description: The ARN of the output that you want to remove.
parameters.name: outputArn

delete.description: Removes an output from an existing flow. This request can be made only on an output that does not have an entitlement associated with it. If the output has an entitlement, you must revoke the entitlement instead. When an entitlement is revoked from a flow, the service automatically removes the associated output.

parameters.description: The flow that is associated with the output that you want to update.
parameters.name: flowArn

parameters.description: The ARN of the output that you want to update.
parameters.name: outputArn

cidrAllowList.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

description.description: A description of the output. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the end user.

destination.description: The IP address where you want to send the output.

encryption.description: Information about the encryption of the flow.

allOf.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).
A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).
The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.
The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

maxLatency.description: The maximum latency in milliseconds for Zixi-based streams.

port.description: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.

protocol.description: The protocol to use for the output.

remoteId.description: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

smoothingLatency.description: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

streamId.description: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.

vpcInterfaceAttachment.description: The settings for attaching a VPC interface to an output.

allOf.description: The name of the VPC interface to use for this output.

parameters.description: The flow that you want to mutate.
parameters.name: flowArn

sources.description: A list of sources that you want to add.

delete.description: Removes a source from an existing flow. This request can be made only if there is more than one source on the flow.

description.description: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.

entitlementArn.description: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

ingestPort.description: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

maxBitrate.description: The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

maxLatency.description: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

protocol.description: The protocol that is used by the source.

streamId.description: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.

vpcInterfaceName.description: The name of the VPC Interface to configure this Source with.

whitelistCidr.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

parameters.description: The name of the VPC interface that you want to remove.
parameters.name: vpcInterfaceName

delete.description: Removes a VPC Interface from an existing flow. This request can be made only on a VPC interface that does not have a Source or Output associated with it. If the VPC interface is referenced by a Source or Output, you must first delete or update the Source or Output to no longer reference the VPC interface.

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per API request. For example, you submit a ListOfferings request with MaxResults set at 5. Although 20 items match your request, the service returns no more than the first 5 items. (The service also returns a NextToken value that you can use to fetch the next batch of results.) The service might return fewer results than the MaxResults value. If MaxResults is not included in the request, the service defaults to pagination with a maximum of 10 results per page.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListOfferings request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListOfferings request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Pagination token

get.description: Displays a list of all offerings that are available to this account in the current AWS Region. If you have an active reservation (which means you've purchased an offering that has already started and hasn't expired yet), your account isn't eligible for other offerings.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the offering.
parameters.name: offeringArn

get.description: Displays the details of an offering. The response includes the offering description, duration, outbound bandwidth, price, and Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the offering.
parameters.name: offeringArn

reservationName.description: The name that you want to use for the reservation.

start.description: The date and time that you want the reservation to begin, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). You can specify any date and time between 12:00am on the first day of the current month to the current time on today's date, inclusive. Specify the start in a 24-hour notation. Use the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ, where T and Z are literal characters. For example, to specify 11:30pm on March 5, 2020, enter 2020-03-05T23:30:00Z.

post.description: Submits a request to purchase an offering. If you already have an active reservation, you can't purchase another offering.

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per API request. For example, you submit a ListReservations request with MaxResults set at 5. Although 20 items match your request, the service returns no more than the first 5 items. (The service also returns a NextToken value that you can use to fetch the next batch of results.) The service might return fewer results than the MaxResults value. If MaxResults is not included in the request, the service defaults to pagination with a maximum of 10 results per page.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results that you want to see. For example, you submit a ListReservations request with MaxResults set at 5. The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. To see the next batch of results, you can submit the ListOfferings request a second time and specify the NextToken value.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

get.description: Displays a list of all reservations that have been purchased by this account in the current AWS Region. This list includes all reservations in all states (such as active and expired).

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the reservation.
parameters.name: reservationArn

get.description: Displays the details of a reservation. The response includes the reservation name, state, start date and time, and the details of the offering that make up the rest of the reservation (such as price, duration, and outbound bandwidth).

allOf.description: A list of outputs that you want to add.

The details of the newly added outputs.

The port to use when content is distributed to this output.

The remote ID for the Zixi-pull output stream.

The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow.
The name of the flow.
The outputs that you want to add to this flow.
The VPC interfaces you want on the flow.

A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

Entitlement.description: The settings for a flow entitlement.

allOf.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
A description of the entitlement.
The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.
The ARN of the entitlement.
An indication of whether the entitlement is enabled.
The name of the entitlement.
The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.
Search window time to look for dash-7 packets

Flow.description: The settings for a flow, including its source, outputs, and entitlements.

allOf.description: The Availability Zone that you want to create the flow in. These options are limited to the Availability Zones within the current AWS.
A description of the flow. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
The IP address from which video will be sent to output destinations.
The entitlements in this flow.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier for any AWS resource, of the flow.
The name of the flow.
The outputs in this flow.
The current status of the flow.
The VPC Interfaces for this flow.

GrantEntitlementRequest.description: The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow.

allOf.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.
The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.
An indication of whether the new entitlement should be enabled or disabled as soon as it is created. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect sets it to ENABLED.
The name of the entitlement. This value must be unique within the current flow.
The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flows using your content as the source.

The service returns the first batch of results (up to 5) and a NextToken value. ListedEntitlement.description: An entitlement that has been granted to you from other AWS accounts.

allOf.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
The ARN of the entitlement.
The name of the entitlement.

ListedFlow.description: Provides a summary of a flow, including its ARN, Availability Zone, and source type.

allOf.description: The Availability Zone that the flow was created in.
A description of the flow.
The ARN of the flow.
The name of the flow.

The type of source. This value is either owned (originated somewhere other than an AWS Elemental MediaConnect flow owned by another AWS account) or entitled (originated at an AWS Elemental MediaConnect flow owned by another AWS account).
The current status of the flow.

Messages.description: Messages that provide the state of the flow.

allOf.description: A list of errors that might have been generated from processes on this flow.

Offering.description: A savings plan that reserves a certain amount of outbound bandwidth usage at a discounted rate each month over a period of time.

allOf.description: The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for all reservations is US dollars.
The length of time that your reservation would be active.
The unit of measurement for the duration of the offering.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.
A description of the offering.
The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate.
The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate.
A definition of the amount of outbound bandwidth that you would be reserving if you purchase the offering.
Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
A description of the output.
The address where you want to send the output.
The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
The ARN of the entitlement on the originator''s flow. This value is relevant only on entitled flows.
The input ARN of the AWS Elemental MediaLive channel. This parameter is relevant only for outputs that were added by creating a MediaLive input.
The name of the output. This value must be unique within the current flow.
The ARN of the output.
The port to use when content is distributed to this output.
Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the output.
The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

PurchaseOfferingRequest.description: A request to purchase a offering.

allOf.description: The name that you want to use for the reservation.

The date and time that you want the reservation to begin, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). You can specify any date and time between 12:00am on the first day of the current month to the current time on today's date, inclusive. Specify the start in a 24-hour notation. Use the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ, where T and Z are literal characters. For example, to specify 11:30pm on March 5, 2020, enter 2020-03-05T23:30:00Z.

PurchaseOfferingRequest.title: PurchaseOfferingRequest

allOf.description: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the output you removed.
The ARN of the output that was removed.
The ARN of the flow that is associated with the source you removed.
The ARN of the source that was removed.
The ARN of the flow that is associated with the VPC interface you removed.
IDs of network interfaces associated with the removed VPC interface that Media Connect was unable to remove.
The name of the VPC interface that was removed.

Reservation.description: A pricing agreement for a discounted rate for a specific outbound bandwidth that your MediaConnect account will use each month over a specific time period. The discounted rate in the reservation applies to outbound bandwidth for all flows from your account until your account reaches the amount of bandwidth in your reservation. If you use more outbound bandwidth than the agreed upon amount in a single month, the overage is charged at the on-demand rate.

allOf.description: The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for your reservation is US dollars.
The length of time that this reservation is active. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
The unit of measurement for the duration of the reservation. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
The day and time that this reservation expires. This value is calculated based on the start date and time that you set and the offering's duration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.
A description of the offering. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the reservation when you purchase an offering.
The name that you assigned to the reservation when you purchased the offering.
The status of your reservation.
A definition of the amount of outbound bandwidth that you would be reserving if you purchase the offering. MediaConnect defines the values that make up the resourceSpecification in the offering.
The day and time that the reservation becomes active. You set this value when you purchase the offering.

ResourceSpecification.description: A definition of what is being billed for, including the type and amount.

allOf.description: The amount of outbound bandwidth that is discounted in the offering.
The type of resource and the unit that is being billed for.
The ARN of the entitlement that was revoked.
The ARN of the flow that the entitlement was revoked from.

SetSourceRequest.description: The settings for the source of the flow.

allOf.description: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.
A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.
The name of the source.
The protocol that is used by the source.
The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
The name of the VPC interface to use for this source.

The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

Source.description: The settings for the source of the flow.

allOf.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.
The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.
A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.

The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to content that comes from another AWS account. The entitlement is set by the content originator and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
The IP address that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
The name of the source.
The ARN of the source.
Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the source.
The name of the VPC Interface this Source is configured with.

The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
The ARN of the flow that you started.
The status of the flow when the StartFlow process begins.
The ARN of the flow that you stopped.
The status of the flow when the StopFlow process begins.

TagResourceRequest.description: The tags to add to the resource. A tag is an array of key-value pairs. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

allOf.description: A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

TagResourceRequest.title: TagResourceRequest

Transport.description: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in a source or output.

allOf.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.
The protocol that is used by the source or output.
The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.
The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.

UpdateEncryption.description: Information about the encryption of the flow.

allOf.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).
A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
The AWS Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up AWS Elemental MediaConnect as a trusted entity).
The ARN of the secret that you created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.
The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.
Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets

UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.description: The entitlement fields that you want to update.

allOf.description: A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.
The type of encryption that will be used on the output associated with this entitlement.

An indication of whether you want to enable the entitlement to allow access, or disable it to stop streaming content to the subscriber’s flow temporarily. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect leaves the value unchanged.
The AWS account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.

UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest.title: UpdateFlowEntitlementRequest

allOf.description: The new configuration of the entitlement that you updated.
The ARN of the flow that this entitlement was granted on.

UpdateFlowOutputRequest.description: The fields that you want to update in the output.

allOf.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.
A description of the output. This description appears only on the AWS Elemental MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the end user.
The IP address where you want to send the output.
The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).
The maximum latency in milliseconds for Zixi-based streams.
The port to use when content is distributed to this output.
The protocol to use for the output.
The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.
The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

UpdateFlowOutputRequest.title: UpdateFlowOutputRequest

allOf.description: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the updated output.
The new settings of the output that you updated.

UpdateFlowSourceRequest.description: A request to update the source of a flow.

allOf.description: The type of encryption used on the content ingested from this source.
A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current AWS Elemental MediaConnect account.
The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.
The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.
The smoothing max bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.
The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.
The protocol that is used by the source.
The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi-based streams.
The name of the VPC Interface to configure this Source with.

The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

UpdateFlowSourceRequest.title: UpdateFlowSourceRequest

allOf.description: The ARN of the flow that you want to update.
The settings for the source of the flow.

VpcInterface.description: The settings for a VPC Source.

allOf.description: Immutable and has to be a unique against other VpcInterfaces in this Flow
IDs of the network interfaces created in customer's account by MediaConnect.
Role Arn MediaConnect can assumes to create ENIs in customer's account
Security Group IDs to be used on ENI.
Subnet must be in the AZ of the Flow

VpcInterfaceAttachment.description: The settings for attaching a VPC interface to an output.

allOf.description: The name of the VPC interface to use for this output.

VpcInterfaceRequest.description: Desired VPC Interface for a Flow

allOf.description: The name of the VPC Interface. This value must be unique within the current flow.
Role Arn MediaConnect can assumes to create ENIs in customer's account
Security Group IDs to be used on ENI.
Subnet must be in the AZ of the Flow
